actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to allow the Commissioner of Social Security reasonable discretion in applying the 10-year marriage requirement for entitlement of divorced spouses to spousal benefits in cases in which the divorce is in whole or in part the result of severe spousal or child abuse.
short_title: Social Security Spouse Protection Act of 2003
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Spouse Protection Act of 2003 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act (SSA) to allow the Commissioner of Social Security reasonable discretion in applying the ten-year marriage requirement for entitlement of divorced spouses to spousal benefits in cases in which the divorce is in whole or in part the result of severe spousal or child abuse.

titles.title: Social Security Spouse Protection Act of 2003

To amend title II of the Social Security Act to allow the Commissioner of Social Security reasonable discretion in applying the 10-year marriage requirement for entitlement of divorced spouses to spousal benefits in cases in which the divorce is in whole or in part the result of severe spousal or child abuse.
